item.title: Junction of Albert St and Mornington Place, 5th December
item.description:
The bollard preventing large vehicles using Albert as a cut through between Camden Town and the West End has been removed. It looks like someone has used bolt cutters to break the lock. This has happened a couple of times before a couple of times and people soon get wise to the fact that they can easily use this access point as a cut through. Please could you replace the bollard or install an APR camera to protect the area from unwanted traffic.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Albert Street, Fitzrovia, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Moving and Uneven pavement, 5th December
item.description:
Moving and uneven paving slabs outside 10 Valley Road. This has been "repaired" a few times but whatever is being done isn't working! The last contractor was there for 15 minutes and put some sand/grit down but once it rains the paving slabs become loose again! This has caused several people to trip.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 22,24, Valley Road, St Paul's Cray, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large flytip, 5th December
item.description:

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Torrance Close, Charlton

item.title: Flooded Subway, 5th December
item.description:
Crittals corner is flooded mainly due to the mud and leaves not being cleared a few weeks ago! This is now making the school children from Kemnal cross the road over the roundabout which is making it dangerous for them and motorists. This needs to be cleared urgently and maintained more regularly.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Sevenoaks Way, St Paul's Cray, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree branches encroaching on private property, falling debris will damage wall, 5th December
item.description:
The tree outside of my house has branches which are at least 6 feet over my front garden wall. Falling branches will no doubt damage what is already an unstable wall due to the roots of the tree disturbing the foundations. Would prefer for the tree to be gently pollarded than end up having it to make an insurance claim due to this lack of maintenance by Bromley Council.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ridgeway Drive, Sundridge, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
